title: 13th
reason: This is an excellent documentary on Netflix that outlines the racism towards Black people in America.

title: Explained: The Racial Wage Gap
reason: This short episode of Explained on Netflix does an excellent job explaining the racial wage gap in America.

title: Who Killed Malcolm X?
reason: This documentary series on Netflix covers the historical events around the murder of Malcolm X.

title: When They See Us
reason: This 4 part series on Netflix is the story of the Central Park 5.

title: Talks to help you understand racism in America
reason: This a good list of TED Talks that help educate about the racism in America.

title: Stamped from the Beginning - The Definitive History of Racist Ideas in America
reason: This is a FREE audio book that does a great job going in depth about the historical racism in America.

title: So You Want to Talk about Race
reason: This book shares the truths about the realities of racism, power and oppression.

title: The Colors of Us
reason: This book is a positive message that celebrates the differences and similarities that connect all people.

title: Waking Up White
reason: This book explores race with the desire to understand the racial divide.

title: 1619 (NYTimes)
reason: This is a podcast series on how slavery has transformed America, connecting past and present through the oldest form of storytelling.

title: Code Switch
reason: This is a great podcast talking about various topics and conversations about race.

title: Pod Save the People
reason: This podcast offers a unique take on the news, with a special focus on overlooked stories and topics that often impact people of color.

title: Our National Conversation About Race
reason: This podcast is a lively multiracial, interracial conversation about the ways we can’t talk, don’t talk, would rather not talk about race.

title: The Death of George Floyd, In Context
reason: This New Yorker article outlines the details around the incidents that sparked the Black Lives Matter movement in America after the death of George Floyd.

title: How to Make This Moment the Turning Point for Real Change
reason: This blog post by Barack Obama talks about how change can happen.

title: For Our White Friends Desiring to Be Allies
reason: This is a great article helping to educate people on how they can be strong allies.

title: Black Lives Matter Newsletter
reason: An email newsletter to get updates about the 2020 election cycle from Black Lives Matter.

title: Me and White Supremacy
reason: This book is a good resource for examining and owning responsibility for the ways in which they uphold white supremacy.

title: White Fragility
reason: A book that explores the counterproductive reactions white people have when their assumptions about race are challenged, and how these reactions maintain racial inequality.

title: How To Be An Antiracist
reason: This book covers Ibram X. Kendi's concept of antiracism reenergizes and reshapes the conversation about racial justice in America.

title: Policing Black Lives
reason: This book covers the state violence in Canada from slavery to the present.

title: How to Talk to Your Kids About Race and Being Antiracist
reason: An article with tips on how to talk with your kids about racism and how they can be anti-racist.

title: Your Parenting Mojo: Wait, Is My Toddler Racist?
reason: This podcast episode is part of a series on understanding the intersection of race, privilege, and parenting.

title: Parenting for the Future
reason: This podcast covers a lot of great topics around talking about racism with your children.

title: Keep That Normal
reason: A blog post of reflections of the emotional battle being Black during the COVID pandemic.

title: Throughline: American Police
reason: This podcast episode covers the origins of American policing and how those origins put violent control of Black Americans at the heart of the system.

title: My Time as a Black Woman Software Engineer at Capital One
reason: A blog post reflecting on what it's like to be a Black woman in technology.

title: Better Allies Newsletter
reason: An excellent weekly newsletter that shares helpful tips on how to become a better ally.

title: Brené with Ibram X. Kendi on How to Be an Antiracist
reason: An episode of Unlocking Us podcast with Brené Brown interviewing Ibram X. Kendi about how to be an antiracist.

title: Why Can't We Teach Slavery Right in American Schools?
reason: A NY Times article on why slavery is mistaught in American schools.

title: Talking to kids about race
reason: An article to help with conversations with kids and not shy away from those conversations is the first step in raising an anti-racist child.

title: The Systems that Protect Police
reason: A NY Times podcast around why misconduct procedures are rarely enough to discipline officers using excessive force.

title: Message to White Allies from A Black Anti-Racism Expert: You’re Doing It Wrong
reason: An article sharing perspectives for allies to learn from spiritual teachers like the Dalai Lama.

title: My experiences of systemic racism and sexism at Pixar
reason: A Muslim woman shares her experiences dealing with racism and sexism in the workplace.

title: Pinterest Sounds A More Contrite Tone After Black Former Employees Speak Out
reason: An example of how Black employees have been treated in tech companies.

title: What Black Employee Resource Groups Need Right Now
reason: An article provides good insights into improving ERGs and what Black ERGs need right now.

title: Eddie Glaude - This is Us MSNBC
reason: Eddie Glaude talks about why blaming current racial tensions on Donald Trump misses the point.

title: Racism Is Real
reason: A 3-minute video explaining the differential in the white and black lived experience.

title: ‘Intergroup anxiety’: Can you try too hard to be fair?
reason: Explores why we may get tongue tied and blunder when we encounter people from groups unfamiliar to us.

title: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Discussing Race
reason: A TEDx talk by Jay Smooth that suggests a new way to think about receiving feedback on our racial blindspots.

title: Let's get to the root of racial injustice
reason: A TEDx talk by Megan Ming Francis that traces the root causes of our current racial climate to their core causes, debunking common misconceptions and calling out "fix-all" cures to a complex social problem.

title: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Discussing Race
reason: A TEDx talk by Jay Smooth that suggests a new way to think about receiving feedback on our racial blindspots.

title: How to deconstruct racism, one headline at a time
reason: A TED Talk by Baratunde Thurston that explores patterns revealing our racist framing, language, and behaviors.
